The correct timeline is: (2) The host says he thought it was fake until notable retweets showed it was real. (4) A tweet from Chris Burke is displayed while the host reads about coaches calling Aaron Glenn. (1) He analyzes Ravens' rushing vs passing numbers, saying the Lions sold out against the run. (5) He claims the Ravens left eighteen points on the field due to a Hollywood drop and a poor Mark Andrews adjustment. (6) The sign-off arrives with the host thanking viewers as a hip-hop instrumental plays over a "Team #KeepItClean" graphic glitch. (3) He angrily references "fourth and nineteen."

Therefore, the answer is C: 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 1 -> 6 -> 5.

The answer is A: 2 -> 1 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6 -> 7.
The sequence starts with the speaker criticizing cornerbacks for their celebration of receiver drops, followed by his comment about Hollywood dropping passes and staying wide open. This is then followed by his observation that what happened was scary and real. The next part of the speech involves the speaker addressing those who only look at statistics and mentions the Ravens holding the team to one touchdown. After this, he talks about the Ravens being wide open and mentions two dropped touchdowns and a deep pass, referencing coaches asking how to defend them. Finally, the speaker concludes by saying that the Ravens were the best defense against themselves and hoping that their coach gets a head coaching job. As he signs off, he appears in a black hoodie labeled "RAVENS".
